OW2 em si é um jogo muito divertido porem tem uns fatores que simplesmente tiram toda a graça do jogo sendo eles (Analise baseada em partidas competitivas): 

1) Eu tenho certeza que aquela patente da ATVI de afetar negativamente a jogabilidade do jogador bom (Diminuindo o dano dele, deixando a mira mais difícil de controlar etc...) está em vigor nesse jogo porque tem uns momentos que não fazem sentido, as vezes parece que um inimigo está dando 3x mais dano com X personagem, você pega o mesmo personagem e parece que não ele da o mesmo, e tem exemplos que eu posso usar aqui mas não vou me entender muito, apenas pesquisem "activision patent skill based damage" ou qualquer outra pesquisa relacionada a matchmaking da atvi

2) Matchmaking é horrível, o jogo faz questão de selecionar os piores possíveis para colocar no seu time, uma partida ranqueada platina parece que os cara são bronze com noção zero de jogo enquanto o time inimigo parece que ta os 5 jogando em party, sem falar dos espanhol especial que não registra dano e te da 8x mais dano que o normal

3) Cheio de cara usando "esquema" de no recoil e é bem fácil de notar quando tem alguém usando no recoil (principalmente com o soldado) e parece que a blizzard nem se importa com isso porem com todos dessas patentes de penalizar o jogador bom eu não duvido nada que seja alguma feature para ajudar o cara...

Uma coisa que eu notei também, as primeiras partida do dia (ou após um certo tempo sem jogar) é "normal", tudo funcionando corretamente, arma matando, jogadores bons (dos dois lados) e ninguém especial se destacando mas após algumas partidas você começa encontrar todo tipo de problema possível, matchmaking demorando, Aliado ruim no seu time e bons do outro, Não é a toa que o jogo perdeu bastante a player base...

OW2 é um jogo bom e divertido mas pelos motivo acima (que acontece comigo e pode não acontecer com você) as vezes fica chato/Injusto/Não divertido

the shop sucks, yeah. But besides the swap to 5v5 its still overwatch. 

lets be honest here, 70% of the playerbase didn't actually care about PvE skill trees and just wanted to complain about blizzard. not that I blame them, Blizzard is a scummy company. but if you can ignore the shop, its not as bad as everyone says it is. half these comments likely only played season 1 and 2, and installed the game just to shit talk in the reviews. 

thats not to say this game doesnt have flaws. god no. supports have had power creep since OW1 and they refuse to nerf them, playing tank is worse than jumping into an industrial meat grinder, and dps are cancer as they were in OW1. Push sucks, fighting whatever character Blizzard decides gets to be OP this week can suck depending on comp.


again, if it looks interesting, give it a shot. the only thing you have to lose is time

Does this mean that Overwatch is back?

... No
Don't support Blizzard.

I've loved Overwatch since I bought it back in 2017. The original modes (unranked/casual and competitive) haven't really changed, other than going from 6v6 to 5v5, but that wasn't too bad of a change. 
I love the new push game mode they introduced recently! I also love the summer games that happen each year. Lucioball is like Rocket League but instead of cars, it's Lucio, so it's so much easier to move around. The workshop mode is also a great addition, being a sort of introduction into game development, made in the context of Overwatch, perfect for introducing people to how game design and development works!

I'm really happy this game has come to Steam, it means that i don't have to bother with multiple different launchers. It also means that it works seamlessly on my Steam Deck (other than the text being small, but that doesn't bother me too much). I just spent some time playing the free mission on the Steam Deck and i really enjoyed myself. Can't wait for the next free one to come out!

I do have a few negative things to say about this game: 
Although i don't mind some characters needing to be unlocked, i do not like that people can just pay to skip this entirely. That is almost borderline pay to win, and it's on the wrong side of the border. 
Also, as i stated earlier, I am not a fan of the switch to 5v5, although I understand that's probably due to this game's slowly declining popularity, so I don't blame Blizzard for that one. 
Finally, I am not a fan of how the community was lied to about the PvE in this game. Yes, PvE has been added, but not in the way/to the extent that Blizzard promised. Personally, I was never too invested in the PvE (hence why I'm not more upset about it), but I still don't like how this has been handled. Also there was a small part of me that was hoping that people who originally paid for the game would get the PvE for free, but alas my dream was too good to be true haha.

If there was a way to rank the trend of updates happening to this game, I would rank this game as mostly negative. Alas, i cannot, so i am rating the entire game, which i believe to be mostly a positive experience. Maybe if Steam adds a "mixed" rating, i will change it to that.

I've never felt so depressed playing a video game before.

Overwatch 2, when i first played it, was one of the biggest disappointments i had played up to that point. I loved the first game, played it to death on console in its glory days. The game effectively died off because they worked on this one, and now that the PvE is cancelled, the sequel has no purpose and the first game dying off was all for nothing.

I played it for about 30 hours on PC last year before completely giving up on it. I returned to it, checking out if they had fixed any of the glaring problems from launch. Spoiler alert: Not at all. Be aware that i have not experienced the "Invasion" missions, so i can't critique those.

There is still no progression aside from the battle pass, roll queues still exist, everything is still absurdly expensive, the team-based gameplay structure still has fatal flaws that have not been ironed out and heroes are still locked behind the pass and limits experimentation of new content.

Fuck this game.
